orego.core

Class Coordinates

  • java.lang.Object
    • orego.core.Coordinates

  • public final class Coordinates
extends Object
    This class manages coordinates on the board.

    A point is represented as a single int. This is an index into a one-dimensional array representing the board, with a buffer of sentinel points around the edges.

    The standard idiom for accessing all points on the board is: 

     for (int p : ALL_POINTS_ON_BOARD) {
        // Do something with p
 }
    The standard idiom for accessing all neighbors of point p is: 
     for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
        int n = NEIGHBORS[p][i];
        // Do something with n, which might be an off-board point with the color
        // OFF_BOARD_COLOR
 }
    To access diagonal neighbors, do the same, but with 0 and 4 replaced with 4 and 8.

    On those rare occasions where rows and columns are used, rows are always zero-based from the top, columns from the left.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int[] ALL_POINTS_ON_BOARD
      An array of all the points on the board, for iterating through.
      static int BOARD_AREA
      Number of points on the board.
      static int BOARD_WIDTH
      Width of the board, e.g., 9 or 19.
      static int EAST
      Add this amount to move east one column, or subtract to move west.
      static boolean[] EDGE_OR_CORNER
      True for edge and corner points, false for others.
      static int EXTENDED_BOARD_AREA
      Number of points on the board including the buffer of sentinels around the outside.
      static int[] EYELIKE_THRESHOLD
      If there are this many enemy stones on diagonal neighbors, a point is not eyelike.
      static int FIRST_POINT_BEYOND_BOARD
      Highest index of any point on the board.
      static int FIRST_POINT_ON_BOARD
      Useful in loops over board points.
      static int[][] KNIGHT_NEIGHBORHOOD
      KNIGHT_NEIGHBORHOOD[p] is an array of points within a knight's move of p.
      static int[][] LARGE_KNIGHT_NEIGHBORHOOD
      LARGE_KNIGHT_NEIGHBORHOOD[p] is an array of points within a large knight's move of p.
      static int[][] NEIGHBORS
      For each point, the four orthogonal neighbors (indices 0-3) and the four diagonal neighbors (4-7).
      static int NO_POINT
      Special coordinate for no point.
      static boolean[] ON_BOARD
      True for points on the board.
      static int PASS
      Special coordinate for passing.
      static int RESIGN
      Special coordinate for a resignation move.
      static int SOUTH
      Add this amount to move south one row, or subtract to move north.
      static int[] THIRD_AND_FOURTH_LINE_POINTS
      An array of all the points on the third or fourth line, for iterating through.
      static boolean[] THIRD_OR_FOURTH_LINE
      True for 3rd or 4th line points, false for others.

      static int at(int r, int c)
      Returns the int representation of the point at row r, column c.

      Returns the int representation of the point described by label, which might be something like "A5", "b3", or "PASS".

      Returns the column of point p.

      Returns the column c as a lower case letter.

      Returns a String representation of column c.

      Returns the Euclidean distance from p1 to p2.
      static int line(int p)
      Returns p's line (1-based) from the edge of the board

      Returns the Manhattan distance from p1 to p2.

      Returns a String representation of point.

      Returns the row of point p.

      Returns the row r as a lower case letter.

      Returns a String representation of row r.
      static int sgfToPoint(String label)
      Returns the point represented by an sgf String.

      • LARGE_KNIGHT_NEIGHBORHOOD

        public static final int[][] LARGE_KNIGHT_NEIGHBORHOOD
        LARGE_KNIGHT_NEIGHBORHOOD[p] is an array of points within a large knight's move of p.

      • NEIGHBORS

        public static final int[][] NEIGHBORS
        For each point, the four orthogonal neighbors (indices 0-3) and the four diagonal neighbors (4-7). If a point is at the edge (corner) of the board, one (two) of its neighbors are off-board points. The neighbors of an off-board point are not defined. The neighbors are ordered like this: 
         405
 1 2
 637

      • NO_POINT

        public static final int NO_POINT
        Special coordinate for no point.

        True for 3rd or 4th line points, false for others.
